title: Chennai Weather: Heavy Rain Likely In Chennai For 2 Days, Orange Alert In 4 TN Districts - News18
summary:
Chennai Weather: Heavy Rain Likely In Chennai For 2 Days, Orange Alert In 4 TN Districts

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: News18

The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a weather warning for Chennai due to a low-pressure area in the Bay of Bengal. The effects are expected to last for several days.

  • A low-pressure area has formed over the South Bay of Bengal.
  • An orange alert has been issued for very heavy rainfall in several districts.
  • Heavy rain is expected in Chennai and surrounding areas on December 17 and 18.
  • The rain is likely to intensify on December 19 and continue until December 20.
  • Chennai, Chengalpattu, Tiruvallur, and Puducherry are among the districts affected.
"The Meteorological Department warns of very heavy rainfall on Tuesday and expects rainfall to begin around 1 pm, intensifying throughout the day."

This weather condition is significant for the affected areas, with warnings issued to prepare for potential heavy rainfall impacts.
newTitle: Chennai Weather Forecast: Heavy Rain and Orange Alert for Tamil Nadu

Disgruntled Chhagan Bhujbal hits out at Ajit Pawar: ‘I am not a toy in anyone’s hand’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Disgruntled Chhagan Bhujbal hits out at Ajit Pawar: ‘I am not a toy in anyone’s hand’

Publication Date: Tuesday, December 12, 2024

Source: Indian Express

Senior NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal expressed his frustration after not being inducted into Maharashtra’s Cabinet, claiming that his opposition to Jarange-Patil led to his exclusion despite the Chief Minister’s support for his inclusion.

  • Bhujbal felt neglected by Ajit Pawar, voicing his concerns publicly.
  • He accused Ajit Pawar of controlling party decisions and hinting that he was excluded as punishment for his stance on Maratha rights.
  • Bhujbal plans to convene supporters in Nashik to discuss his future after feeling disregarded by the party leadership.
  • He expressed dissatisfaction about being treated as a mere pawn in political decisions.
  • Senior NCP leader Praful Patel affirmed Bhujbal's desire to join the Rajya Sabha but there were complications with candidate selections.
“I am not a toy in your hands who will follow blindly everything… Chhagan Bhujbal is not that kind of man.”

In conclusion, Bhujbal's statements highlight internal party conflicts and the challenges within the NCP as leaders navigate their political ambitions amid shifting alliances.
newTitle: Chhagan Bhujbal Criticizes Ajit Pawar Over Cabinet Exclusion

One nation, one election bills introduced in Lok Sabha, 269 MPs vote in favour - Hindustan Times
summary:
One Nation, One Election Bills Introduced in Lok Sabha

Date: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Lok Sabha witnessed the introduction of bills aimed at holding simultaneous elections for the Lok Sabha and state assemblies, which garnered substantial support but faced sharp criticism from opposition parties.

  • Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal introduced two constitutional amendment bills for simultaneous elections.
  • A total of 269 MPs voted in favor of the bills while 198 opposed them.
  • The opposition, including Congress, Samajwadi Party, and Trinamool Congress, raised concerns about the constitutionality and potential threats to democratic processes.
  • Opposition MPs argued the bills undermine the Constitution's basic structure and are a step towards 'dictatorship.'
  • The bills propose amendments to hold mid-term elections only for the legislatures affected, delaying simultaneous elections until 2034.
“Introduction, consideration of one nation, one election bills beyond the legislative competence of this House, urge govt to withdraw it,” said Congress MP Manish Tewari.

The proposed changes have sparked widespread debate about their implications for democratic accountability and governance in India.
newTitle: One Nation, One Election Bills Introduced in Lok Sabha with Support from 269 MPs

title: Parliament session LIVE: Law minister tables bill for one nation, one election in Lok Sabha - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bills for One Nation, One Election Introduced in Lok Sabha

Date: December 17, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Winter Session of Parliament, initiated on November 25, has entered its final week. The central government has introduced a constitutional amendment bill for simultaneous Lok Sabha and assembly elections.

  • Union law minister Arjun Ram Meghwal introduced the 'One Nation, One Election' bill.
  • The bill is part of the BJP's 2024 election manifesto, supported by PM Modi but opposed by various political parties.
  • The Congress has ordered its MPs to attend the Lok Sabha session for discussions on the bill.
  • The Rajya Sabha is engaged in a debate celebrating 75 years of the Constitution.
“The 'One Nation, One Election' Bill is a direct attack on federalism,” said Shiv Sena leader Anil Desai during discussions.

The introduction of these bills is stirring significant political debate regarding their implications for federal structure and democratic accountability in India.
newTitle: Bills for One Nation, One Election Introduced in Lok Sabha

'Why Would I Live Separately Then?': Atul Subhash's Wife Nikita Singhania On Harassment Allegations - News18
summary:
'Why Would I Live Separately Then?': Nikita Singhania Responds to Harassment Allegations

Date: December 17, 2024
Source: News18

Nikita Singhania, in a recent police investigation regarding her estranged husband Atul Subhash’s suicide, denied all allegations of harassment. She stated that she had been living apart from him for three years.

  • Nikita claims Atul harassed her, contrary to his accusations.
  • Atul Subhash's family expressed disappointment over the legal system, feeling it favors women.
  • Atul was found dead with a suicide note highlighting his struggles.
  • The police arrested Nikita and her family related to the case.
“Justice is due,” - Inscription from Atul's suicide note.

This incident has raised significant discussions on the domestic issues and legal protections available to men.
newTitle: 'Why Would I Live Separately Then?': Nikita Singhania Responds to Harassment Allegations

Day after Palestine bag, Priyanka Gandhi carries tote with ‘Bangladesh’ message to Parliament - Hindustan Times
summary:
Day after Palestine bag, Priyanka Gandhi carries tote with ‘Bangladesh’ message to Parliament

Date: December 16, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Priyanka Gandhi has drawn attention once again by carrying a tote bag with messages highlighting the atrocities faced by minorities in Bangladesh, just a day after her earlier appearance with a bag supporting Palestine.

  • Priyanka and other Opposition MPs protested in Parliament with tote bags and placards advocating for minority rights in Bangladesh.
  • The attention on Priyanka Gandhi's Palestine bag raised discussions about the Indian government's stance on Bangladesh's minority issues.
  • She criticized the BJP for focusing on her choice of bag rather than addressing the pressing issues of minority rights.
  • Opposition members have been using symbolic gestures to draw attention to various political issues during the current Winter Session of Parliament.
Priyanka Gandhi stated, "The atrocities happening in Bangladesh, against minorities and Hindus...something should be done regarding this. Talks should be held with Bangladesh govt regarding this...and they should not say such useless things".

This latest appearance by Priyanka Gandhi reinforces the ongoing political discourse around minority rights in Bangladesh and the strategic use of symbolism in political protests.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Highlights Bangladesh Minorities' Plight with New Tote Bag at Parliament

title: NTA to conduct only entrance exams for higher education institutions and not recruitment exams: Pradhan - The Indian Express
summary:
NTA to Focus Solely on Entrance Exams for Higher Education from 2025

Publication Date: December 17, 2024, Source: Indian Express

The National Testing Agency (NTA) will solely conduct entrance exams for higher education institutions starting in 2025, as announced by Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan in the Parliament. The move comes amid ongoing discussions with the Health Ministry regarding the NEET-UG exam format.

  • NTA shifts focus to entrance exams only, excluding recruitment tests.
  • Discussions ongoing with Health Ministry about NEET-UG format (pen-paper vs online).
  • Common University Entrance Test (CUET)-UG will still be held annually.
  • NTA to be restructured in 2025 with the creation of 10 new posts.
  • Recent exam cancellations due to leaks have prompted these reforms.
“There was no data on record to indicate a systemic leak of question paper and other malpractices.” — CJI

This decision marks a significant shift in the NTA's role in educational assessments, focusing on enhancing the integrity and structure of the examination process going forward.
newTitle: NTA to Focus Solely on Entrance Exams for Higher Education from 2025

title: IIM CAT Result 2024 Live Update: How to check final answer key? - The Indian Express
‘India was just an ally’: Bangladesh politicians upset over PM Modi's Vijay Diwas post - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bangladesh Politicians Criticize Modi's Vijay Diwas Post for Ignoring Bangladesh

Date: December 17, 2024, Source: HT News

Bangladeshi politicians expressed their discontent over Prime Minister Modi's social media post regarding Vijay Diwas, where he failed to mention Bangladesh's significant role in the 1971 liberation war.

  • PM Modi commemorated Indian soldiers’ victory over Pakistan on December 16, 1971.
  • Critics from Bangladesh highlighted the exclusion of their country in the context of the war's significance for their independence.
  • Increased tensions exist between India and Bangladesh over treatment of the Hindu minority in Bangladesh.
  • Bangladesh's ex-prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been mentioned in relation to ongoing political instability in Bangladesh.
Asif Nazrul (law adviser to Muhammad Yunus): “I strongly protest. December 16, 1971, was the day of Bangladesh's victory. India was an ally in this victory, nothing more.”
“I strongly condemn and protest against Narendra Modi's misleading statement on 16th December, Bangladesh's Victory Day.” - Ishraque Hossain (Bangladesh Nationalist Party)

The reactions from Bangladeshi politicians signal potential strains in the diplomatic relationship between the two nations, emphasizing the importance of recognizing Bangladesh's history and sovereignty.
newTitle: Bangladesh Politicians Criticize Modi's Vijay Diwas Post for Ignoring Bangladesh

Parliament Winter Session Day 18 LIVE Updates: Simultaneous elections Bill likely to be introduced in Lok Sabha; Rajya Sabha resumes Constitution Debate - The Hindu
summary:
Parliament Winter Session Day 18 LIVE Updates: Division of votes in LS after Opposition seeks withdrawal of ONOE bill; Constitution debate continues in RS

Date: December 17, 2024
Source: The Hindu

The 18th day of the winter session of Parliament saw significant discussions regarding the One Nation One Election (ONOE) bill as well as constiutional debates within the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha. The opposition is pushing for the withdrawal of the controversial bill while various MPs voiced their perspectives on critical issues.

  • The ONOE bill aims to synchronize Lok Sabha and State Assembly elections.
  • Opposition members issued a whip for their presence in the Lok Sabha during crucial discussions.
  • RJD MP Prof. Manoj Kumar Jha highlighted concerns over using names in political narratives.
  • During discussions, concerns were raised about the legality of powers given to the Election Commission.
“One Nation, One Election bills assault on basic structure doctrine of Constitution.” – Congress MP Manish Tewari

This day in Parliament showcases the continued tension between the government and opposition on legislative matters that have far-reaching implications for electoral processes in India.
newTitle: Parliament Winter Session: Day 18 Updates on ONOE Bill and Constitution Debate

title: Parliament Winter Session Day 18 LIVE Updates: Bill on simultaneous elections likely to be introduced in Lok Sabha - The Hindu
"Who's Going To Decide What I Wear?" Priyanka Gandhi On 'Palestine' Bag Row - NDTV
summary:
Who's Going To Decide What I Wear?' Priyanka Gandhi On 'Palestine' Bag Row

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: NDTV

Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has addressed the backlash over her use of a bag emblazoned with 'Palestine', calling the reaction a reflection of typical patriarchy.

  • Priyanka criticized BJP's protests against her choice of the bag, asserting her right to wear what she chooses.
  • The bag also featured a watermelon symbol, representing solidarity with Palestine.
  • Her comments come in the wake of criticism from BJP MPs, who accused her of appeasement.
  • The Congress MP urged the government to focus on protecting minorities in Bangladesh rather than on her bag.
  • The Ministry of External Affairs reiterated India's consistent stance on the Palestine issue, advocating for a two-state solution.
“Who is going to decide what clothes I wear now? That's typical patriarchy...” — Priyanka Gandhi Vadra

This incident has ignited a significant political debate, highlighting ongoing tensions around domestic and international perceptions of the Palestine issue.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Responds to Controversy Over 'Palestine' Bag
